rows.translation: In the name of Allah, most benevolent, ever-merciful.
TA SIN MIM.
These are the verses of the perspicuous Book.

rows.arabic: لَعَلَّكَ بَـٰخِعٌ نَّفْسَكَ أَلَّا يَكُونُوا۟ مُؤْمِنِينَ
rows.translation: You may perhaps wear out your heart because they do not come to belief.
rows.transliteration: la`allaka bākhi`un nafsaka allā yakūnū mu-minīn

rows.arabic: إِن نَّشَأْ نُنَزِّلْ عَلَيْهِم مِّنَ ٱلسَّمَآءِ ءَايَةً فَظَلَّتْ أَعْنَـٰقُهُمْ لَهَا خَـٰضِعِينَ
rows.translation: We could send down from the heavens a sign to them if We pleased, before which their heads would remain bowed.
rows.transliteration: in nasha-nunazzil `alayhim minas samā-i āyatan faẓallat a`nāquhum lahā khāḍi`īn

rows.arabic: وَمَا يَأْتِيهِم مِّن ذِكْرٍ مِّنَ ٱلرَّحْمَـٰنِ مُحْدَثٍ إِلَّا كَانُوا۟ عَنْهُ مُعْرِضِينَ
rows.translation: Never does a new reminder come to them from Ar-Rahman but they turn away from it.
rows.transliteration: wa mā ya-tīhim min dhikrin minar raḥmāni muḥdathin illā kānū `anhu mu`riḍīn

rows.arabic: فَقَدْ كَذَّبُوا۟ فَسَيَأْتِيهِمْ أَنۢبَـٰٓؤُا۟ مَا كَانُوا۟ بِهِۦ يَسْتَهْزِءُونَ
rows.translation: Surely they have done with denying; soon will come to them the news of what they were laughing at.
rows.transliteration: faqad kadhhabū fasaya-tīhim anbā-u mā kānū bihi yastahzi-ūn

rows.arabic: أَوَلَمْ يَرَوْا۟ إِلَى ٱلْأَرْضِ كَمْ أَنۢبَتْنَا فِيهَا مِن كُلِّ زَوْجٍ كَرِيمٍ
rows.translation: Do they not see the earth, how We grow all kinds of noble things upon it?
rows.transliteration: awalam yaraw ilal-arḍi kam anbatnā fīhā min kulli zawjin karīm

rows.arabic: إِنَّ فِى ذَٰلِكَ لَـَٔايَةً ۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكْثَرُهُم مُّؤْمِنِينَ
rows.translation: Verily there are signs in this; yet many of them do not believe.
rows.transliteration: inna fī dhālika la-āyah ۖ wa mā kāna aktharuhum mu-minīn

rows.translation: Your Lord is surely mighty and merciful.

rows.arabic: وَإِذْ نَادَىٰ رَبُّكَ مُوسَىٰٓ أَنِ ٱئْتِ ٱلْقَوْمَ ٱلظَّـٰلِمِينَ
rows.translation: When your Lord called upon Moses: "Go to the wicked people,
rows.transliteration: wa idh nādā rabbuka mūsā ani-til qawmaẓ ẓālimīn

rows.translation: The people of Pharaoh. Will they not fear and take heed?"

rows.arabic: قَالَ رَبِّ إِنِّىٓ أَخَافُ أَن يُكَذِّبُونِ
rows.translation: : He said: "O Lord, I fear that they will deny me.
rows.transliteration: qāla rabbi innī akhāfu an yukadhhibūn

rows.arabic: وَيَضِيقُ صَدْرِى وَلَا يَنطَلِقُ لِسَانِى فَأَرْسِلْ إِلَىٰ هَـٰرُونَ
rows.translation: My heart is constrained, my tongue falters, so delegate Aaron;
rows.transliteration: wayaḍīqu ṣadrī walā yanṭaliqu lisānī fa-arsil ilā hārūn

rows.arabic: وَلَهُمْ عَلَىَّ ذَنۢبٌ فَأَخَافُ أَن يَقْتُلُونِ
rows.translation: And they have a charge (of murder) against me. So I fear that they will kill me."

rows.arabic: قَالَ كَلَّا ۖ فَٱذْهَبَا بِـَٔايَـٰتِنَآ ۖ إِنَّا مَعَكُم مُّسْتَمِعُونَ
rows.translation: (It was) said: "By no means. Go with My signs, both of you. I am verily with you and I hear.
rows.transliteration: qāla kallā ۖ fadh-habā bi-āyātinā ۖ innā ma`akum mustami`ūn

rows.arabic: فَأْتِيَا فِرْعَوْنَ فَقُولَآ إِنَّا رَسُولُ رَبِّ ٱلْعَـٰلَمِينَ
rows.translation: Go to the Pharaoh and tell him: 'We bring a message from the Lord of all the worlds
rows.transliteration: fa-tiyā fir`awna faqūlā innā rasūlu rabbil `ālamīn

rows.translation: That you should send the children of Israel with us.'

rows.arabic: قَالَ أَلَمْ نُرَبِّكَ فِينَا وَلِيدًا وَلَبِثْتَ فِينَا مِنْ عُمُرِكَ سِنِينَ
rows.translation: (The Pharaoh) said: "Did we not bring you up as a child? And you lived a number of years of your life with us.
rows.transliteration: qāla alam nurabbika fīnā walīdan walabithta fīnā min `umurika sinīn

rows.arabic: وَفَعَلْتَ فَعْلَتَكَ ٱلَّتِى فَعَلْتَ وَأَنتَ مِنَ ٱلْكَـٰفِرِينَ
rows.translation: And you commited what you did, and you are ungrateful!"
rows.transliteration: wafa`alta fa`latakal latī fa`alta wa-anta minal kāfirīn

rows.arabic: قَالَ فَعَلْتُهَآ إِذًا وَأَنَا۠ مِنَ ٱلضَّآلِّينَ
rows.translation: (Moses) replied: "I did do that and I was in the wrong,
rows.transliteration: qāla fa`altuhā idhan wa-ana minaḍ ḍāllīn

rows.arabic: فَفَرَرْتُ مِنكُمْ لَمَّا خِفْتُكُمْ فَوَهَبَ لِى رَبِّى حُكْمًا وَجَعَلَنِى مِنَ ٱلْمُرْسَلِينَ
rows.translation: So I ran away from you out of fear. But my Lord has given me wisdom, and made me an apostle.
rows.transliteration: fafarartu minkum lammā khiftukum fawahaba lī rabbī ḥukman waja`alanī minal mursalīn

rows.arabic: وَتِلْكَ نِعْمَةٌ تَمُنُّهَا عَلَىَّ أَنْ عَبَّدتَّ بَنِىٓ إِسْرَٰٓءِيلَ
rows.translation: But the favour you oblige me with is that you have enslaved the children of Israel."
rows.transliteration: watilka ni`matun tamunnuhā `alayya an `abbadta banī isrā-iyl

rows.translation: The Pharaoh asked: "And what is the Lord of all the worlds?"

rows.arabic: قَالَ رَبُّ ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضِ وَمَا بَيْنَهُمَآ ۖ إِن كُنتُم مُّوقِنِينَ
rows.translation: (Moses) said: "The Lord of the heavens and the earth and all that lies between them, if you can believe."
rows.transliteration: qāla rabbus samāwāti wal-arḍi wa mā baynahumā ۖ in kuntum mūqinīn

rows.translation: (The Pharaoh) said to those around him: "Do you hear?"
(Moses continued): "Your Lord and the Lord of your fathers before you."

rows.arabic: قَالَ إِنَّ رَسُولَكُمُ ٱلَّذِىٓ أُرْسِلَ إِلَيْكُمْ لَمَجْنُونٌ
rows.translation: (The Pharaoh) said (to his nobles): "Your apostle who has been sent to you, is certainly mad."
rows.transliteration: qāla inna rasūlakumul ladhī ursila ilaykum lamajnūn

rows.arabic: قَالَ رَبُّ ٱلْمَشْرِقِ وَٱلْمَغْرِبِ وَمَا بَيْنَهُمَآ ۖ إِن كُنتُمْ تَعْقِلُونَ
rows.translation: (Moses) said: "The Lord of the East and the Lord of the West and all that lies between them, if you have sense."
rows.transliteration: qāla rabbul mashriqi wal maghribi wa mā baynahumā ۖ in kuntum ta`qilūn

rows.arabic: قَالَ لَئِنِ ٱتَّخَذْتَ إِلَـٰهًا غَيْرِى لَأَجْعَلَنَّكَ مِنَ ٱلْمَسْجُونِينَ
rows.translation: (The Pharaoh) said: "If you took another god apart from me I will have you incarcerated."
rows.transliteration: qāla la-init-takhadhta ilāhan ghayrī la-aj`alannaka minal masjūnīn

rows.translation: (Moses) said: "Even though I have brought to you something convincing?"

rows.arabic: قَالَ فَأْتِ بِهِۦٓ إِن كُنتَ مِنَ ٱلصَّـٰدِقِينَ
rows.translation: (The Pharaoh) said: "Then bring it, if you speak the truth."
rows.transliteration: qāla fa-ti bihi in kunta minaṣ ṣādiqīn

rows.arabic: فَأَلْقَىٰ عَصَاهُ فَإِذَا هِىَ ثُعْبَانٌ مُّبِينٌ
rows.translation: So (Moses) cast his staff, and lo, it turned into a living serpent.

rows.arabic: وَنَزَعَ يَدَهُۥ فَإِذَا هِىَ بَيْضَآءُ لِلنَّـٰظِرِينَ
rows.translation: And he drew forth his hand, and lo, it looked white to the beholders.
rows.transliteration: wanaza`a yadahu fa-idhā hiya bayḍā-u linnāẓirīn

rows.arabic: قَالَ لِلْمَلَإِ حَوْلَهُۥٓ إِنَّ هَـٰذَا لَسَـٰحِرٌ عَلِيمٌ
rows.translation: The Pharaoh said to the chiefs around him: "He is certainly a clever magician.
rows.transliteration: qāla lil-mala-i ḥawlahu inna hādhā lasāḥirun `alīm

rows.arabic: يُرِيدُ أَن يُخْرِجَكُم مِّنْ أَرْضِكُم بِسِحْرِهِۦ فَمَاذَا تَأْمُرُونَ
rows.translation: He wants to drive you out of your land by his magic. So, what do you bid?"
rows.transliteration: yurīdu an yukhrijakum min arḍikum bisiḥrihi famādhā ta-murūn

rows.arabic: قَالُوٓا۟ أَرْجِهْ وَأَخَاهُ وَٱبْعَثْ فِى ٱلْمَدَآئِنِ حَـٰشِرِينَ
rows.translation: They said: "Put him and his brother off awhile, and send summoners to the cities to gather
rows.transliteration: qālū arjih wa-akhāhu wab`ath fil madā-ini ḥāshirīn

rows.translation: And bring the ablest magicians to you."
So the magicians were assembled at a stated time and place on an appointed day.
And the people were also asked to assemble.

rows.arabic: لَعَلَّنَا نَتَّبِعُ ٱلسَّحَرَةَ إِن كَانُوا۟ هُمُ ٱلْغَـٰلِبِينَ
rows.translation: (They said): "We may haply follow the magicians if they are victorious."
rows.transliteration: la`allanā nattabi`us saḥarata in kānū humul ghālibīn

rows.arabic: فَلَمَّا جَآءَ ٱلسَّحَرَةُ قَالُوا۟ لِفِرْعَوْنَ أَئِنَّ لَنَا لَأَجْرًا إِن كُنَّا نَحْنُ ٱلْغَـٰلِبِينَ
rows.translation: When the magicians arrived, they said to the Pharaoh: "Is there a reward for us if we are victorious?" --
rows.transliteration: falammā jā-as saḥaratu qālū lifir`awna a-inna lanā la-ajran in kunnā naḥnul ghālibīn

rows.arabic: قَالَ نَعَمْ وَإِنَّكُمْ إِذًا لَّمِنَ ٱلْمُقَرَّبِينَ
rows.translation: "Yes," he replied. "You 'will be among the honoured."
rows.transliteration: qāla na`am wa innakum idhal laminal muqarrabīn

rows.arabic: قَالَ لَهُم مُّوسَىٰٓ أَلْقُوا۟ مَآ أَنتُم مُّلْقُونَ
rows.translation: Moses said to them: "Cast what you have to cast."
rows.transliteration: qāla lahum mūsā alqū mā antum mulqūn

rows.arabic: فَأَلْقَوْا۟ حِبَالَهُمْ وَعِصِيَّهُمْ وَقَالُوا۟ بِعِزَّةِ فِرْعَوْنَ إِنَّا لَنَحْنُ ٱلْغَـٰلِبُونَ
rows.translation: So they cast their ropes and rods, and said: "By the glory of Pharaoh, we shall be victorious."
rows.transliteration: fa-alqaw ḥibālahum wa`iṣiyyahum waqālū bi`izzati fir`awna innā lanaḥnul ghālibūn

rows.arabic: فَأَلْقَىٰ مُوسَىٰ عَصَاهُ فَإِذَا هِىَ تَلْقَفُ مَا يَأْفِكُونَ
rows.translation: Then Moses threw down his staff, and lo, it swallowed up their conjurations.
rows.transliteration: fa-alqā mūsā `aṣāhu fa-idhā hiya talqafu mā ya-fikūn

rows.translation: Then the magicians fell prostrating in adoration,
And said: "We (affirm and) believe in the Lord of all the worlds,
The Lord of Moses and Aaron."

rows.arabic: قَالَ ءَامَنتُمْ لَهُۥ قَبْلَ أَنْ ءَاذَنَ لَكُمْ ۖ إِنَّهُۥ لَكَبِيرُكُمُ ٱلَّذِى عَلَّمَكُمُ ٱلسِّحْرَ فَلَسَوْفَ تَعْلَمُونَ ۚ لَأُقَطِّعَنَّ أَيْدِيَكُمْ وَأَرْجُلَكُم مِّنْ خِلَـٰفٍ وَلَأُصَلِّبَنَّكُمْ أَجْمَعِينَ
rows.translation: Said (the Pharaoh): "You have come to believe in him before I gave you leave. He is surely your chief, who taught you magic. You will soon come to know: I will have your hands and feet cut off on alternate sides, and have every one of you crucified."
rows.transliteration: qāla āmantum lahu qabla an ādhana lakum ۖ innahu lakabīrukumul ladhī `allamakumus siḥra falasawfa ta`lamūn ۚ la-uqaṭṭi`anna aydiyakum wa-arjulakum min khilāfin wala-uṣallibannakum ajma`īn

rows.arabic: قَالُوا۟ لَا ضَيْرَ ۖ إِنَّآ إِلَىٰ رَبِّنَا مُنقَلِبُونَ
rows.translation: They said: "There will be no harm. We shall return to our Lord.
rows.transliteration: qālū lā ḍayr ۖ innā ilā rabbinā munqalibūn

rows.arabic: إِنَّا نَطْمَعُ أَن يَغْفِرَ لَنَا رَبُّنَا خَطَـٰيَـٰنَآ أَن كُنَّآ أَوَّلَ ٱلْمُؤْمِنِينَ
rows.translation: We certainly hope our Lord will forgive our sins as we are the first to believe."
rows.transliteration: innā naṭma`u an yaghfira lanā rabbunā khaṭāyānā an kunnā awwalal-mu-minīn

rows.arabic: وَأَوْحَيْنَآ إِلَىٰ مُوسَىٰٓ أَنْ أَسْرِ بِعِبَادِىٓ إِنَّكُم مُّتَّبَعُونَ
rows.translation: We said to Moses: "Travel by night with My creatures. You will surely be pursued."
rows.transliteration: wa-awḥaynā ilā mūsā an asri bi`ibādī innakum muttaba`ūn

rows.translation: Then the Pharaoh sent announcers to the cities,
(Proclaiming): "Surely they are a small band (of fugitives).
They are always harassing us.
But we are a fully accounted army."
So We made them leave the gardens and springs of water,
And treasures and agreeable mansions.
Thus it was; and We made the children of Israel possess them.
But they pursued them at sunrise.

rows.arabic: فَلَمَّا تَرَٰٓءَا ٱلْجَمْعَانِ قَالَ أَصْحَـٰبُ مُوسَىٰٓ إِنَّا لَمُدْرَكُونَ
rows.translation: When the two forces drew within seeing distance of each other, the people of Moses said: "We shall certainly be overtaken."
rows.transliteration: falammā tarā al jam`āni qāla aṣ-ḥābu mūsā innā lamudrakūn

rows.arabic: قَالَ كَلَّآ ۖ إِنَّ مَعِىَ رَبِّى سَيَهْدِينِ
rows.translation: Moses replied: "By no means. My Lord is with me. He will show me the way."
rows.transliteration: qāla kallā ۖ inna ma`iya rabbī sayahdīn

rows.arabic: فَأَوْحَيْنَآ إِلَىٰ مُوسَىٰٓ أَنِ ٱضْرِب بِّعَصَاكَ ٱلْبَحْرَ ۖ فَٱنفَلَقَ فَكَانَ كُلُّ فِرْقٍ كَٱلطَّوْدِ ٱلْعَظِيمِ
rows.translation: We commanded Moses: "Smite the sea with your staff." And it parted, and every parting was like a lofty mountain.
rows.transliteration: fa-awḥaynā ilā mūsā aniḍ-rib bi`aṣākal baḥr ۖ fanfalaqa fakāna kullu firqin kaṭ ṭawdil `aẓīm

rows.translation: Then We brought the others to that place.
We delivered Moses and every one with him,
rows.transliteration: wa-anjaynā mūsā wa man ma`ahu ajma`īn

rows.translation: And We drowned the others.

rows.arabic: إِنَّ فِى ذَٰلِكَ لَـَٔايَةً ۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكْثَرُهُم مُّؤْمِنِينَ
rows.translation: Verily there is a sign in this, but most of them do not believe.
rows.transliteration: inna fī dhālika la-āyah ۖ wa mā kāna aktharuhum mu-minīn

rows.translation: Indeed your Lord is mighty and merciful.
Relate the news of Abraham to them.

rows.arabic: إِذْ قَالَ لِأَبِيهِ وَقَوْمِهِۦ مَا تَعْبُدُونَ
rows.translation: When he asked his father and his people: "What do you worship?"
rows.transliteration: idh qāla li-abīhi waqawmihi mā ta`budūn

rows.arabic: قَالُوا۟ نَعْبُدُ أَصْنَامًا فَنَظَلُّ لَهَا عَـٰكِفِينَ
rows.translation: They replied: "We worship idols and are devoted to them."
(Abraham) asked: "Do they hear when you call them?
Or do they benefit you, or do you harm?"

rows.arabic: قَالُوا۟ بَلْ وَجَدْنَآ ءَابَآءَنَا كَذَٰلِكَ يَفْعَلُونَ
rows.translation: They said: "No. But we found our fathers doing so."
rows.transliteration: qālū bal wajadnā ābā-anā kadhālika yaf`alūn

rows.translation: He said: "Have you considered what you have been worshipping,
rows.transliteration: qāla afara aytum mā kuntum ta`budūn

rows.translation: You and your fathers?

rows.arabic: فَإِنَّهُمْ عَدُوٌّ لِّىٓ إِلَّا رَبَّ ٱلْعَـٰلَمِينَ
rows.translation: Yet they are my enemies except the Lord of all the worlds
Who created me and showed me the way,
Who gives me food and drink,
And heals me when I am sick,
Who will make me die, then give me life again,

rows.arabic: وَٱلَّذِىٓ أَطْمَعُ أَن يَغْفِرَ لِى خَطِيٓـَٔتِى يَوْمَ ٱلدِّينِ
rows.translation: And who, I hope, will condone my faults on the Day of Judgement.
rows.transliteration: wal ladhī aṭma`u an yaghfira lī khaṭī-atī yawmad dīn

rows.arabic: رَبِّ هَبْ لِى حُكْمًا وَأَلْحِقْنِى بِٱلصَّـٰلِحِينَ
rows.translation: O Lord, give me wisdom and admit me among the righteous,
rows.transliteration: rabbi hab lī ḥukman wa-alḥiqnī biṣ ṣāliḥīn

rows.arabic: وَٱجْعَل لِّى لِسَانَ صِدْقٍ فِى ٱلْـَٔاخِرِينَ
rows.translation: And uphold my name with posterity,
And put me among the inheritors of Paradise.

rows.arabic: وَٱغْفِرْ لِأَبِىٓ إِنَّهُۥ كَانَ مِنَ ٱلضَّآلِّينَ
rows.translation: Forgive me and my father: He was surely among those who went astray.
rows.transliteration: waghfir li-abī innahu kāna minaḍ ḍāllīn

rows.translation: And do not disgrace me on the day when they are raised from the graves,

rows.arabic: يَوْمَ لَا يَنفَعُ مَالٌ وَلَا بَنُونَ
rows.translation: The day when neither wealth nor children will be of any avail
rows.transliteration: yawma lā yanfa`u mālun walā banūn

rows.arabic: إِلَّا مَنْ أَتَى ٱللَّهَ بِقَلْبٍ سَلِيمٍ
rows.translation: But to him who comes to God with a tranquil heart."
Paradise will be brought near those who take heed for themselves and follow the straight path;
And Hell made visible to those who had gone astray.

rows.arabic: وَقِيلَ لَهُمْ أَيْنَ مَا كُنتُمْ تَعْبُدُونَ
rows.translation: They will be asked: "Where are those you worshipped
rows.transliteration: waqīla lahum ayna mā kuntum ta`budūn

rows.arabic: مِن دُونِ ٱللَّهِ هَلْ يَنصُرُونَكُمْ أَوْ يَنتَصِرُونَ
rows.translation: Other than God? Can they save you or even save themselves?"
rows.transliteration: min dūnillāhi hal yanṣurūnakum aw yantaṣirūn

rows.translation: They will then be thrown into Hell with those who had gone astray
Together with the hordes of Iblis.
Disputing among themselves they will say:

rows.arabic: تَٱللَّهِ إِن كُنَّا لَفِى ضَلَـٰلٍ مُّبِينٍ
rows.translation: "By God, we were plainly in error
rows.transliteration: tallāhi in kunnā lafī ḍalālin mubīn

rows.translation: In equating you with the Lord of all the worlds;
No one but the sinners led us astray.
Now we have none to intercede for us,
Nor any sincere friend.

rows.arabic: فَلَوْ أَنَّ لَنَا كَرَّةً فَنَكُونَ مِنَ ٱلْمُؤْمِنِينَ
rows.translation: If only we could return and be among the believers!"
rows.transliteration: falaw anna lanā karratan fanakūna minal mu-minīn

rows.arabic: إِنَّ فِى ذَٰلِكَ لَـَٔايَةً ۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكْثَرُهُم مُّؤْمِنِينَ
rows.translation: Verily there is a sign in this, but many of them do not believe.
rows.transliteration: inna fī dhālika la-āyah ۖ wa mā kāna aktharuhum mu-minīn

rows.translation: Verily your Lord is mighty and merciful.
The people of Noah accused the apostles of lies.

rows.arabic: إِذْ قَالَ لَهُمْ أَخُوهُمْ نُوحٌ أَلَا تَتَّقُونَ
rows.translation: When their brother Noah said to them: "Will you not take heed?
rows.transliteration: idh qāla lahum akhūhum nūḥun alā tattaqūn

rows.translation: I have been sent as a trusted messenger to you.
So be fearful of God and listen to me.

rows.arabic: وَمَآ أَسْـَٔلُكُمْ عَلَيْهِ مِنْ أَجْرٍ ۖ إِنْ أَجْرِىَ إِلَّا عَلَىٰ رَبِّ ٱلْعَـٰلَمِينَ
rows.translation: I ask no recompense of you for it. My reward is due from none but the Lord of all the worlds.
rows.transliteration: wa mā as-alukum `alayhi min ajr ۖ in ajriya illā `alā rabbil `ālamīn

rows.translation: So fear God and follow me."
They said: "Should we place our trust in you when only the condemned follow you?"

rows.arabic: قَالَ وَمَا عِلْمِى بِمَا كَانُوا۟ يَعْمَلُونَ
rows.translation: He said: "It is not for me to know what they were doing.
rows.transliteration: qāla wa mā `il-mī bimā kānū ya`malūn

rows.arabic: إِنْ حِسَابُهُمْ إِلَّا عَلَىٰ رَبِّى ۖ لَوْ تَشْعُرُونَ
rows.translation: It is for my Lord to bring them to book, if you can understand.
rows.transliteration: in ḥisābuhum illā `alā rabbī ۖ law tash`urūn

rows.translation: I am certainly not one to drive away the believers.
I am only a plain admonisher."

rows.arabic: قَالُوا۟ لَئِن لَّمْ تَنتَهِ يَـٰنُوحُ لَتَكُونَنَّ مِنَ ٱلْمَرْجُومِينَ
rows.translation: They said: "If you do not desist, O Noah, you will be stoned to death."
rows.transliteration: qālū la-in lam tantahi yānūḥu latakūnanna minal marjūmīn

rows.translation: He prayed: "O Lord, verily my people accuse me of lies.

rows.arabic: فَٱفْتَحْ بَيْنِى وَبَيْنَهُمْ فَتْحًا وَنَجِّنِى وَمَن مَّعِىَ مِنَ ٱلْمُؤْمِنِينَ
rows.translation: So adjudge between me and them conclusively, and save me and the believers who are with me."
rows.transliteration: faftaḥ baynī wabaynahum fat-ḥan wanajjinī wa man ma`iya minal mu-minīn

rows.arabic: فَأَنجَيْنَـٰهُ وَمَن مَّعَهُۥ فِى ٱلْفُلْكِ ٱلْمَشْحُونِ
rows.translation: So We delivered him and those with him in the loaded ark,
rows.transliteration: fa-anjaynāhu wa man ma`ahu fil fulkil mashḥūn

rows.translation: And drowned the rest of them.

rows.arabic: إِنَّ فِى ذَٰلِكَ لَـَٔايَةً ۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكْثَرُهُم مُّؤْمِنِينَ
rows.translation: Verily there is a sign in this, yet many of them do not believe.
rows.transliteration: inna fī dhālika la-āyah ۖ wa mā kāna aktharuhum mu-minīn

rows.translation: But surely your Lord is mighty and merciful.
The people of 'Ad accused the messengers of lies.

rows.arabic: إِذْ قَالَ لَهُمْ أَخُوهُمْ هُودٌ أَلَا تَتَّقُونَ
rows.translation: When their brother Hud said to them: "Will you not take heed?
rows.transliteration: idh qāla lahum akhūhum hūdun alā tattaqūn

rows.translation: I have been sent as a trusted messenger to you.
So fear God and listen to me.

rows.arabic: وَمَآ أَسْـَٔلُكُمْ عَلَيْهِ مِنْ أَجْرٍ ۖ إِنْ أَجْرِىَ إِلَّا عَلَىٰ رَبِّ ٱلْعَـٰلَمِينَ
rows.translation: I ask no recompense of you for it. My reward is due from none but the Lord of all the worlds.
rows.transliteration: wa mā as-alukum `alayhi min ajr ۖ in ajriya illā `alā rabbil `ālamīn

rows.translation: You construct monuments on every hill in vain,
Erect palaces (thinking) that you will live for ever,
And whenever you apply force become tyrannical.
So be fearful of God and follow me.
Fear Him who has bestowed on you what you know,
Gave you increase of cattle and sons,
And orchards and springs.

rows.arabic: إِنِّىٓ أَخَافُ عَلَيْكُمْ عَذَابَ يَوْمٍ عَظِيمٍ
rows.translation: I fear the punishment of a terrible day for you.

rows.arabic: قَالُوا۟ سَوَآءٌ عَلَيْنَآ أَوَعَظْتَ أَمْ لَمْ تَكُن مِّنَ ٱلْوَٰعِظِينَ
rows.translation: They said: "It is the same to us if you warn us or do not warn.
rows.transliteration: qālū sawā-un `alaynā awa`aẓta am lam takun minal wā`iẓīn

rows.translation: This is just a habit of antiquated people.
We are not going to be damned."

rows.arabic: فَكَذَّبُوهُ فَأَهْلَكْنَـٰهُمْ ۗ إِنَّ فِى ذَٰلِكَ لَـَٔايَةً ۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكْثَرُهُم مُّؤْمِنِينَ
rows.translation: Then they accused him of lies; so We annihilated them. Verily there is a sign in this, but most of them do not believe.
rows.transliteration: fakadhhabūhu fa-ahlaknāhum ۗ inna fī dhālika la-āyah ۖ wa mā kāna aktharuhum mu-minīn

rows.translation: Yet surely your Lord is mighty and merciful.
The Thamud accused the messengers of lies.

rows.arabic: إِذْ قَالَ لَهُمْ أَخُوهُمْ صَـٰلِحٌ أَلَا تَتَّقُونَ
rows.translation: When their brother Saleh said to them: "Will you not take heed?"
rows.transliteration: idh qāla lahum akhūhum ṣāliḥun alā tattaqūn

rows.translation: I have been sent as a trusted messenger to you.
So fear God and follow me.

rows.arabic: وَمَآ أَسْـَٔلُكُمْ عَلَيْهِ مِنْ أَجْرٍ ۖ إِنْ أَجْرِىَ إِلَّا عَلَىٰ رَبِّ ٱلْعَـٰلَمِينَ
rows.translation: I do not ask any recompense of you for this. My reward is due from none but the Lord of all the worlds.
rows.transliteration: wa mā as-alukum `alayhi min ajr ۖ in ajriya illā `alā rabbil `ālamīn

rows.translation: (Do you think) you will be left secure here
In these gardens and these springs,
The fields of corn and date-palm trees with soft and tender spathes,
And dwellings hewed out of mountains ingeniously?
So be mindful of God and listen to me.
Do not follow those who are extravagant,

rows.arabic: ٱلَّذِينَ يُفْسِدُونَ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ وَلَا يُصْلِحُونَ
rows.translation: Who corrupt the land and do not reform it."
They said: "Surely you are deluded.

rows.arabic: مَآ أَنتَ إِلَّا بَشَرٌ مِّثْلُنَا فَأْتِ بِـَٔايَةٍ إِن كُنتَ مِنَ ٱلصَّـٰدِقِينَ
rows.translation: You are nothing but a man like us. Bring us a token if you speak the truth."
rows.transliteration: mā anta illā basharun mithlunā fa-ti bi-āyatin in kunta minaṣ ṣādiqīn

rows.arabic: قَالَ هَـٰذِهِۦ نَاقَةٌ لَّهَا شِرْبٌ وَلَكُمْ شِرْبُ يَوْمٍ مَّعْلُومٍ
rows.translation: (Saleh) said: "Here is a she-camel. She has a right of drinking water, and you have a right of drinking it on appointed turns.
rows.transliteration: qāla hādhihi nāqatun lahā shirbun walakum shirbu yawmin ma`lūm

rows.arabic: وَلَا تَمَسُّوهَا بِسُوٓءٍ فَيَأْخُذَكُمْ عَذَابُ يَوْمٍ عَظِيمٍ
rows.translation: Do not treat her unkindly or the punishment of a grievous day will fall on you."
But they hamstrung her; and on the morrow were repentant,

rows.arabic: فَأَخَذَهُمُ ٱلْعَذَابُ ۗ إِنَّ فِى ذَٰلِكَ لَـَٔايَةً ۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكْثَرُهُم مُّؤْمِنِينَ
rows.translation: For they were seized by the torment. Verily there was a sign in this, but most of them did not believe.
rows.transliteration: fa-akhadhahumul `adhāb ۗ inna fī dhālika la-āyah ۖ wa mā kāna aktharuhum mu-minīn

rows.translation: Yet verily your Lord is mighty and merciful.
The people of Lot accused the messengers of lies.

rows.arabic: إِذْ قَالَ لَهُمْ أَخُوهُمْ لُوطٌ أَلَا تَتَّقُونَ
rows.translation: When their brother Lot said to them: "Will you not take heed?
rows.transliteration: idh qāla lahum akhūhum lūṭun alā tattaqūn

rows.translation: I have been sent as a trusted messenger to you.
So fear God and listen to me.

rows.arabic: وَمَآ أَسْـَٔلُكُمْ عَلَيْهِ مِنْ أَجْرٍ ۖ إِنْ أَجْرِىَ إِلَّا عَلَىٰ رَبِّ ٱلْعَـٰلَمِينَ
rows.translation: I ask no recompense of you for this. My reward is due from none but the Lord of all the worlds.
rows.transliteration: wa mā as-alukum `alayhi min ajr ۖ in ajriya illā `alā rabbil `ālamīn

rows.translation: Why do you go for males unlike all other creatures

rows.arabic: وَتَذَرُونَ مَا خَلَقَ لَكُمْ رَبُّكُم مِّنْ أَزْوَٰجِكُم ۚ بَلْ أَنتُمْ قَوْمٌ عَادُونَ
rows.translation: Leaving the consorts your Lord has made for you? But you are a people who exceed the bounds."
rows.transliteration: watadharūna mā khalaqa lakum rabbukum min azwājikum ۚ bal antum qawmun `ādūn

rows.arabic: قَالُوا۟ لَئِن لَّمْ تَنتَهِ يَـٰلُوطُ لَتَكُونَنَّ مِنَ ٱلْمُخْرَجِينَ
rows.translation: They said: "If you do not desist, O Lot, you will be expelled (from the city)."
rows.transliteration: qālū la-in lam tantahi yālūṭu latakūnanna minal mukhrajīn

rows.translation: (Lot) said: "I am disgusted with your actions,"
(And prayed:) "O Lord, save me and my family from what they do."
So We saved him and his whole family
Except one old woman who remained behind.
Then We destroyed the rest of them,

rows.arabic: وَأَمْطَرْنَا عَلَيْهِم مَّطَرًا ۖ فَسَآءَ مَطَرُ ٱلْمُنذَرِينَ
rows.translation: And rained on them a shower (of Stones). How terrible was the rain (that fell) on those who had been warned!

rows.arabic: إِنَّ فِى ذَٰلِكَ لَـَٔايَةً ۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكْثَرُهُم مُّؤْمِنِينَ
rows.translation: Verily in this was a sign, but most of them do not believe.
rows.transliteration: inna fī dhālika la-āyah ۖ wa mā kāna aktharuhum mu-minīn

rows.translation: Yet surely your Lord is mighty and powerful.
The people of the Wood too called the messengers liars.

rows.arabic: إِذْ قَالَ لَهُمْ شُعَيْبٌ أَلَا تَتَّقُونَ
rows.translation: When Shu'aib said to them: "Will you not take heed?
rows.transliteration: idh qāla lahum shu`aybun alā tattaqūn

rows.translation: I have been sent as a trusted messenger to you.
So fear God and follow me.

rows.arabic: وَمَآ أَسْـَٔلُكُمْ عَلَيْهِ مِنْ أَجْرٍ ۖ إِنْ أَجْرِىَ إِلَّا عَلَىٰ رَبِّ ٱلْعَـٰلَمِينَ
rows.translation: I ask no recompense of you for this. My reward is due from none but the Lord of all the worlds.
rows.transliteration: wa mā as-alukum `alayhi min ajr ۖ in ajriya illā `alā rabbil `ālamīn

rows.arabic: أَوْفُوا۟ ٱلْكَيْلَ وَلَا تَكُونُوا۟ مِنَ ٱلْمُخْسِرِينَ
rows.translation: Give full measure and do not cheat;
rows.transliteration: awful kayla walā takūnū minal mukhsirīn

rows.translation: Weigh on an even balance.

rows.arabic: وَلَا تَبْخَسُوا۟ ٱلنَّاسَ أَشْيَآءَهُمْ وَلَا تَعْثَوْا۟ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ مُفْسِدِينَ
rows.translation: And do not withhold from people what belongs to them, and do not corrupt the land;
rows.transliteration: walā tabkhasun nāsa ashyā-ahum walā ta`thaw fil-arḍi mufsidīn

rows.translation: And fear Him who created you and all the earlier people."
They said: "Surely you are deluded.

rows.arabic: وَمَآ أَنتَ إِلَّا بَشَرٌ مِّثْلُنَا وَإِن نَّظُنُّكَ لَمِنَ ٱلْكَـٰذِبِينَ
rows.translation: You are nothing but a man like us, and we think you are a liar.
rows.transliteration: wa mā anta illā basharun mithlunā wa in naẓunnuka laminal kādhibīn

rows.arabic: فَأَسْقِطْ عَلَيْنَا كِسَفًا مِّنَ ٱلسَّمَآءِ إِن كُنتَ مِنَ ٱلصَّـٰدِقِينَ
rows.translation: But in case you are speaking the truth, then make a segment of the sky to fall upon us."
rows.transliteration: fa-asqiṭ `alaynā kisafan minas samā-i in kunta minaṣ ṣādiqīn

rows.translation: (Shu'aib) said: "My Lord knows well what you are doing."

rows.arabic: فَكَذَّبُوهُ فَأَخَذَهُمْ عَذَابُ يَوْمِ ٱلظُّلَّةِ ۚ إِنَّهُۥ كَانَ عَذَابَ يَوْمٍ عَظِيمٍ
rows.translation: But they denied him, and We seized them with the torment of the Day of Shadowing (when the cloud had rained down fire). It was indeed the torment of a terrible day!
rows.transliteration: fakadhhabūhu fa-akhadhahum `adhābu yawmiẓ ẓullah ۚ innahu kāna `adhāba yawmin `aẓīm

rows.arabic: إِنَّ فِى ذَٰلِكَ لَـَٔايَةً ۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكْثَرُهُم مُّؤْمِنِينَ
rows.translation: Verily in this was a sign, but most of them do not believe.
rows.transliteration: inna fī dhālika la-āyah ۖ wa mā kāna aktharuhum mu-minīn

rows.translation: Yet verily your Lord is mighty and merciful.
And this (Qur'an) is a revelation from the Lord of all the worlds,
Which the trusted spirit descended with
To (communicate) to your heart that you may be a warner
In eloquent Arabic.
This is (indicated) in the Books of earlier people.

rows.arabic: أَوَلَمْ يَكُن لَّهُمْ ءَايَةً أَن يَعْلَمَهُۥ عُلَمَـٰٓؤُا۟ بَنِىٓ إِسْرَٰٓءِيلَ
rows.translation: Was it not a proof for them that the learned men of Israel knew about this?
rows.transliteration: awalam yakun lahum āyatan an ya`lamahu `ulamā-u banī isrā-iyl

rows.translation: Had We revealed it to a man of obscure tongue

rows.arabic: فَقَرَأَهُۥ عَلَيْهِم مَّا كَانُوا۟ بِهِۦ مُؤْمِنِينَ
rows.translation: And he had recited it to them, and they had not believed (it would have been different).
Thus do We cause (unbelief) to enter the hearts of sinners.

rows.arabic: لَا يُؤْمِنُونَ بِهِۦ حَتَّىٰ يَرَوُا۟ ٱلْعَذَابَ ٱلْأَلِيمَ
rows.translation: They will not believe it until they behold the painful punishment.
It will come upon them unawares, and they will not comprehend it.
Then will they say: "Can we be given respite?"
Do they wish Us then to hasten the punishment?
Just think: If We let them enjoy (the good things of life) for a few years more,
And then what they were promised comes upon them,

rows.arabic: مَآ أَغْنَىٰ عَنْهُم مَّا كَانُوا۟ يُمَتَّعُونَ
rows.translation: Of what avail shall their enjoyment be to them?

rows.arabic: وَمَآ أَهْلَكْنَا مِن قَرْيَةٍ إِلَّا لَهَا مُنذِرُونَ
rows.translation: Never have We destroyed a habitation till We had sent admonishers to them
rows.transliteration: wa mā ahlaknā min qaryatin illā lahā mundhirūn

rows.translation: To warn. For We are never unjust.
The devils did not bring it down:
They are not worthy of it, nor have they power.
rows.transliteration: wa mā yanbaghī lahum wa mā yastaṭī`ūn

rows.translation: They have been precluded from hearing it.

rows.arabic: فَلَا تَدْعُ مَعَ ٱللَّهِ إِلَـٰهًا ءَاخَرَ فَتَكُونَ مِنَ ٱلْمُعَذَّبِينَ
rows.translation: So call on no other god but God, lest you are condemned to torment;
rows.transliteration: falā tad`u ma`allāhi ilāhan ākhara fatakūna minal mu`adhhabīn

rows.translation: And warn your near relations,

rows.arabic: وَٱخْفِضْ جَنَاحَكَ لِمَنِ ٱتَّبَعَكَ مِنَ ٱلْمُؤْمِنِينَ
rows.translation: And take those believers under your wing who follow you.

rows.arabic: فَإِنْ عَصَوْكَ فَقُلْ إِنِّى بَرِىٓءٌ مِّمَّا تَعْمَلُونَ
rows.translation: If they do not obey you, tell them: "I am not responsible for what you do."
rows.transliteration: fa-in `aṣawka faqul innī barī-un mimmā ta`malūn

rows.translation: Have trust in the Mighty, the Merciful,
Who watches you when you get up,
And your movements among those who bow in homage to God.
He is all-hearing and all-knowing.

rows.arabic: هَلْ أُنَبِّئُكُمْ عَلَىٰ مَن تَنَزَّلُ ٱلشَّيَـٰطِينُ
rows.translation: Should I tell you on whom the devils descend?
They come down to every mendacious sinner,
Who listens to you (for spreading rumours); but most of them are liars.
As for the poets, only those who go astray follow them.

rows.arabic: أَلَمْ تَرَ أَنَّهُمْ فِى كُلِّ وَادٍ يَهِيمُونَ
rows.translation: Have you not seen that they wander distract in every valley,
rows.transliteration: alam tara annahum fī kulli wādiy yahīmūn

rows.translation: And they say what they do not do,

rows.arabic: إِلَّا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ وَعَمِلُوا۟ ٱلصَّـٰلِحَـٰتِ وَذَكَرُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ كَثِيرًا وَٱنتَصَرُوا۟ مِنۢ بَعْدِ مَا ظُلِمُوا۟ ۗ وَسَيَعْلَمُ ٱلَّذِينَ ظَلَمُوٓا۟ أَىَّ مُنقَلَبٍ يَنقَلِبُونَ
rows.translation: Except those who believe and do the right, and remember God a great deal, who retaliate only when they have been wronged. Yet the oppressors will now come to know through what reversals they will be overthrown!
rows.transliteration: illal ladhīna āmanū wa`amiluṣ ṣāliḥāti wadhakarullāha kathīran wantaṣarū min ba`di mā ẓulimū ۗ wasaya`lamul ladhīna ẓalamū ayya munqalabiy yanqalibūn
